source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行六波羅蜜時，見眾生短命，當作是願：『我作佛時，令我國土中眾生壽命無量劫。』
translation: When the bodhisattva Mahāsattva practices the six perfections and sees that the lives of sentient beings are short, he makes this vow: 'When I become a buddha, I will cause the lives of sentient beings in my land to be countless eons.'

source_sentence: 乃至近一切種智。
translation: ... until he approaches the knowledge of all kinds.

source_sentence: 「復次，須菩提！
translation: "Furthermore, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行六波羅蜜時，見眾生無有相好，當作是願：『我作佛時，令我國土中眾生皆有三十二相成就。』
translation: When the bodhisattva Mahāsattva practices the six perfections, he sees that sentient beings lack facial features and makes this vow: 'When I become a buddha, I will cause all the sentient beings in my land to have the accomplishment of the thirty-two marks.'

source_sentence: 乃至近一切種智。
translation: ... until they approach the cognition of all distinctive qualities.

source_sentence: 「復次，須菩提！
translation: "Furthermore, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行六波羅蜜時，見眾生離諸善根，當作是願：『我作佛時，令我國土中眾生諸善根成就，以是福德，供養諸佛。』
translation: When the bodhisattva Mahāsattva practices the six perfections, he sees sentient beings free of good roots and makes this vow: 'When I become a buddha, I'll cause sentient beings in my land to achieve good roots and make offerings to the buddhas with these merits.'

source_sentence: 乃至近一切種智。
translation: ... and approach omniscience.

source_sentence: 「復次，須菩提！
translation: "Furthermore, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行六波羅蜜時，見眾生有三毒、四病，當作是願：『我作佛時，令我國土中眾生無四種病：冷、熱、風病、三種雜病，及三毒病。』
translation: When the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices the six perfections and sees that sentient beings have the three poisons and four illnesses, he makes this vow: 'When I become a buddha, I will cause sentient beings in my land to have no four kinds of illnesses: cold, heat, wind, three kinds of mixed illnesses, and the three poisons.'

source_sentence: 乃至近一切種智。
translation: ... until they approach the knowledge of all kinds.

source_sentence: 「復次，須菩提！
translation: "Furthermore, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行六波羅蜜時，見眾生有三乘，當作是願：『我作佛時，令我國土中眾生無二乘之名，純一大乘。』
translation: When the bodhisattva Mahāsattva practices the six perfections and sees that sentient beings have three vehicles, he should make this vow: 'When I become a buddha, I will cause the sentient beings in my land to have no claim to be two vehicles and to be purely one great vehicle.'

source_sentence: 乃至近一切種智。
translation: ... until they approach the knowledge of all kinds.

source_sentence: 「復次，須菩提！
translation: "Furthermore, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行六波羅蜜時，見眾生有增上慢，當作是願：『我作佛時，令我國土中眾生無增上慢之名。』
translation: When a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices the six perfections and sees that sentient beings have arrogance, he should make this vow: 'When I become a buddha, I will cause sentient beings in my land to have no reputation for arrogance.'

source_sentence: 乃至近一切種智。
translation: ... until they approach the knowledge of all kinds.

source_sentence: 「復次，須菩提！
translation: "Furthermore, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行六波羅蜜時，應作是願：『若我光明、壽命有量，僧數有限，當作是願：「我行六波羅蜜，淨佛世界、成就眾生；我作佛時，令我光明、壽命無量，僧數無限。」』
translation: When bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas practice the six perfections, they should make this vow: 'If my light and life expectancy are measured and the number of saṃgha is limited, they should make this vow: "I'll practice the six perfections to purify the Buddha world and bring sentient beings to completion; when I become a buddha, that will give me unlimited light and life expectancy and an unlimited number of saṃgha."'

source_sentence: 乃至近一切種智。
translation: ... up to near-omniscience.

source_sentence: 「復次，須菩提！
translation: "Furthermore, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行六波羅蜜時，應作是願：『若我國土有量，當作是願：「我隨爾所時行六波羅蜜，淨佛世界、成就眾生；我作佛時，令我一國土如恒河沙等諸佛世界。」』
translation: When a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices the six perfections, he or she should make this vow: 'If there were an amount of my land, they should make this vow: "I practice the six perfections at such and such times to purify the Buddha-realm and bring prosperity to sentient beings; when I become a buddha, I will make my one land equal to the worlds of the buddhas such as the Ganges River Sands."'

source_sentence: 須菩提！
translation: Subhūti!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩作如是行，能具足六波羅蜜，近一切種智。
translation: By doing so, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva can fully possess the six perfections and approach omniscience.

source_sentence: 「復次，須菩提！
translation: "Furthermore, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行六波羅蜜時，當作是念：『雖生死道長、眾生性多，爾時應如是正憶念——生死邊如虛空，眾生性邊亦如虛空，是中實無生死往來，亦無解脫者。』
translation: When the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices the six perfections, he should think, 'Although the path of birth-and-death is long and the natures of sentient beings are numerous, at that point he should correctly recall in this way that the limits of birth-and-death are like space and the limits of the natures of sentient beings are also like space, and there's really no passing through birth-and-death or liberation in them.'

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩作如是行，能具足六波羅蜜，近一切種智。」
translation: By doing so, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva can fully possess the six perfections and approach omniscience."

source_sentence: 【論】問曰：有何次第故，說菩薩見眾生饑寒、凍餓等？
translation: [Commentary] Q: What is the order in which it's said that bodhisattvas see sentient beings who are hungry, cold, and cold?

source_sentence: 答曰：菩薩過聲聞、辟支佛地，得無生法忍、授記，更無餘事，唯行淨佛世界、成就眾生。
translation: Answer: After passing through the stages of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas, a bodhisattva attains the patient acceptance of the nonarising of qualities and is granted assurance of assurance of future attainment, and there's nothing more to do than to purify the Buddha's world and bring sentient beings to completion.

source_sentence: 今說淨佛世界因緣，見不淨世界相，願我國土無如是事。
translation: Now, I've explained the causes and conditions for purifying the Buddha world and seeing the characteristics of the impure world, hoping that there are no such things in my land.

source_sentence: 是故次第說是事。
translation: That's why we explain these things in order.

source_sentence: 菩薩行檀波羅蜜時，若見眾生飢渴、衣服弊壞，即作念言：「我今福德、智慧未成就，不能給足眾生所須；若我但行慈悲心，則於眾生無益。
translation: When a bodhisattva is practicing the perfection of giving, if he sees that sentient beings are hungry and thirsty, or that their clothing has deteriorated, he thinks, "Now, I haven't yet achieved virtue or wisdom, and I can't meet the needs of sentient beings; if I only practice compassion, it won't be helpful to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我當爾所時，深行三種福德，住三種福德中，能令貧窮眾生皆得滿足：若作轉輪聖王、若作天王、若作神通聖人，則能多引導眾生，破其堅貪，令住布施。」
translation: When I am here, I will deeply practice three kinds of merit and abide in three kinds of merit that will cause poor sentient beings to be fulfilled: if I were a wheel-turning sage king, a heavenly king, or a sage with supernormal powers, then I could often guide sentient beings, break their hard cravings, and cause them to abide in generosity."

source_sentence: 以是眾生布施乃至菩薩布施因緣故，後成佛時，國土中無有貧窮者，心生隨意所得，如欲界第六天所有諸物。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions for living beings' generosity and for the bodhisattvas' generosity, when they later become buddhas, there won't be any poor people in their land whose minds produce whatever they want, such as the things in the sixth heaven of the desire realm.

source_sentence: 菩薩如是隨爾所時積集檀波羅蜜功德故，充滿一切。
translation: Because the bodhisattva thus accumulates the merit of the perfection of giving at that point in time, it fills everything.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 一切有為法屬因緣，行善因緣具足故，皆隨意得果報。
translation: "All artificial dharmas are conditioned by causes and conditions, and because the causes and conditions for practicing goodness are complete, they all will attain their fruition as they wish.

source_sentence: 復次，眾生破尸羅波羅蜜因緣故，短命、多病、無有威德等；菩薩作是願：「我自具足持戒，亦教眾生令持戒。」
translation: Furthermore, when sentient beings lack the causes and conditions for breaking the śīla-pāramitā, their lives are short, they're often ill, and they lack authority, the bodhisattva makes this vow, "I myself am fully upholding the precepts, and I'll teach sentient beings to uphold them."

source_sentence: 餘殘諸願亦如是，隨義分別。
translation: The other remaining vows are likewise, discerned according to their meaning.

source_sentence: 最後願義不明了，今當略說。
translation: The meaning of the last vow is unclear, so I'll explain it briefly.

source_sentence: 菩薩作如是上願已，疲厭心起：「佛道無量無數阿僧祇劫行諸功德，然後可得；但一劫歲數不可得數，故佛以譬喻示人，何況無量無邊阿僧祇劫經此生死受諸苦惱！
translation: After making this superior vow, the bodhisattva's weary mind arises, "The Buddha's path has innumerable and incalculable incalculable eons of merit before it's attained, but an incalculable number of years in an eon makes the Buddha show people by metaphor, so why would he go through this birth-and-death experience of suffering and distress for innumerable and incalculable incalculable eons?

source_sentence: 眾生亦無量無邊，非可譬喻算數所及，但以三千大千世界中微塵等眾生猶尚難度，何況十方無量世界微塵等眾生而可得度！」
translation: Sentient beings are also countless and limitless, beyond metaphors and calculations, but it's still difficult to save a tiny particle of sentient beings in a world of 3,000 great one-thousand worlds, so why would it be possible to save a tiny particle of sentient beings in an infinite number of worlds in ten directions?"

source_sentence: 以是事故，或心生退沒，是名邪憶念。
translation: When this happens, or when the mind retreats, this is called wrong recollection.

source_sentence: 是故佛教是菩薩正憶念：生死雖長，是事皆空，如虛空、如夢中所見，非實長遠，不應生厭心。
translation: Therefore, Buddhists are bodhisattvas who correctly remember that even though birth and death are long, these things are empty, like space or what's seen in a dream, and not really long, so they shouldn't become disillusioned.

source_sentence: 又未來世亦是一念所緣，亦非長遠。
translation: Furthermore, future lives are also the object of a single thought, and they aren't long-lasting either.

source_sentence: 復次，菩薩無量福德智慧力故，能超無量劫。
translation: Furthermore, because of their immeasurable merit and wisdom, bodhisattvas can transcend measureless eons.

source_sentence: 如是種種因緣故，不應生厭心。
translation: Because of these various causes and conditions, they shouldn't become disillusioned.

source_sentence: 此中佛說大因緣，所謂：「生死如虛空，眾生亦如是；眾生雖多，亦無定實眾生。
translation: Here, the Buddha explains the great causes and conditions, saying, "Birth and death are like space, and so are sentient beings; although there are many sentient beings, there are no definite or real sentient beings.

source_sentence: 如眾生無量無邊，佛智慧亦無量無邊，度亦不難，是故菩薩不應生疲厭心。」
translation: As sentient beings are numberless and limitless, so is the Buddha's wisdom, which is also numberless and limitless; it's not difficult to save them; therefore, bodhisattvas shouldn't become weary."

source_sentence: 大智度論釋恒伽提婆品第五十九
translation: Mahāprajñāpāramitā-śāstra, Chapter 59

source_sentence: 【經】爾時，有一女人，字恒伽提婆，在眾中坐。
translation: [Sutra] At the time, there was a woman named Hengadeva who was sitting in the midst of the crowd.

source_sentence: 是女人從坐起，偏袒右肩，右膝著地，合掌白佛言：「世尊！
translation: She got up from her seat, bared her right shoulder, knelt on her right knee, put her palms together, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我當行六波羅蜜，取淨佛世界，如般若波羅蜜中所說，我盡當行。」
translation: I will practice the six perfections to purify the Buddha's world, as explained in the perfections of wisdom, and I will do them all."

source_sentence: 是時，女人以金銀華及水陸生華、種種莊嚴供養之具、金縷織成疊兩張，以散佛上；散已，於佛頂上虛空中化成四柱寶臺，端正嚴好。
translation: The woman then took gold and silver flowers, flowers that grew on land and water, and various ornamental offerings of gold woven into two sheets and scattered them on top of the Buddha, and after they were scattered, they were transformed into a four-poster jeweled dais in the sky above the Buddha's head that was perfectly proportioned and beautiful.

source_sentence: 是女人持是功德，與一切眾生共之，迴向阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: That woman held this merit in common with all sentient beings as she headed toward unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知是女人深心因緣，即時微笑。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān knew the woman's profound aspiration as cause and immediately smiled.

source_sentence: 如諸佛法種種色光從口中出，青、黃、赤、白、紅、縹，遍照十方無量無邊佛國，還遶佛三匝，從頂上入。
translation: Like all the buddhas, beams of various colors emanated from his mouth, blue, yellow, red, white, red, and red, and they shone throughout the measureless and limitless buddha lands in the ten directions, circled the Buddha three times, and entered from the top of his head.

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難從座起，右膝著地，合掌白佛：「佛何因緣微笑？
translation: At that point, Ānanda rose from his seat, knelt on his right knee, put his palms together, and said to the Buddha, "What are the reasons the Buddha smiles?

source_sentence: 諸佛法不以無因緣而笑。」
translation: The teachings of the buddhas don't make you laugh because of a lack of causes and conditions."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「是恒伽提婆姊未來世中當作佛，劫名星宿，佛號金花。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "This is the elder sister of the Ganges Devas who will become a buddha in a future life, whose eon name is Stargazer and whose buddha name is Golden Flower.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 是女人畢女身，受男子形，當生阿閦佛阿毘羅提國土，於彼淨修梵行。
translation: After she finishes her female body, this woman will be born in Akṣobhya's land of Abhirati and will purify her religious practice there.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 是菩薩在彼國土，亦號金花。
translation: That bodhisattva is also called the Golden Flower in that land.

source_sentence: 是金華菩薩於彼壽終，復至他方佛國；從一佛國至一佛國，不離諸佛。
translation: At the end of his life, this golden-flowered bodhisattva again goes to another buddha land in another direction, and from one buddha land to another, he doesn't part from the buddhas.

source_sentence: 譬如轉輪聖王，從一觀至一觀，從生至終，足不蹈地。
translation: It's like a wheel-turning sage king who goes from one contemplation to another and doesn't touch the ground with his feet from birth to death.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 是金花菩薩摩訶薩亦如是，從一佛國至一佛國，乃至阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，未甞不見佛。」
translation: So it is with the golden-flowered bodhisattva Mahāsattva, from one Buddha-land to another, up to the unsurpassed, correct enlightenment, there's never been a time when he hasn't seen a Buddha."

source_sentence: 時，阿難作是念言：「是金華菩薩摩訶薩後作佛時，諸菩薩摩訶薩會，當知為如佛會。」
translation: Ānanda then had this thought, "When this golden-flowered bodhisattva Mahāsattva becomes a buddha later in life, the assembly of bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas should be known as the assembly of such buddhas."

source_sentence: 佛知阿難意所念，告阿難言：「如是！
translation: Knowing what Ānanda was thinking, the Buddha addressed Ānanda, saying, "So it is!

source_sentence: 如是！
translation: So it is!

source_sentence: 是金花佛時菩薩摩訶薩會，當知為如佛會。
translation: This is the Golden Flower Buddha-time bodhisattva-mahāsattva assembly, which should be known as the Tathāgata Buddha assembly.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 是金花佛比丘僧無量無邊、不可數不可數，若干百千萬億那由他。
translation: This golden-flowered Buddhist monk is a monk of measureless and limitless proportions, incalculable and incalculable, and numbering hundreds of thousands of thousands of thousands of nayutas.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 是金花菩薩作佛時，其國土無有是諸眾惡，如上所說。」
translation: When this golden-flowered bodhisattva became a buddha, there were no such various evils in his land, as was explained above."

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是女人從何處殖德本、種善根？」
translation: Where does this woman cultivate roots of virtue and plant wholesome roots?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「是女人從然燈佛所種善根，初發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，以是功德，迴向阿耨多羅三藐三菩提；亦以金華散然燈佛上，求阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "That woman planted good roots with Randana Buddha, first aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, and then scattered gold flowers over Randana Buddha to seek unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如我爾時以五華散然燈佛上，求阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: Just then, I scattered the five flowers on Randhāna Buddha and asked for unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.

source_sentence: 然燈佛知我善根成就，與我受阿耨多羅三藐三菩提記。
translation: Knowing that my good roots were complete, Randana Buddha gave me the assurance that I would receive the assurance of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.

source_sentence: 是女人聞我受記，發心言：『我當來世亦如是菩薩，得受阿耨多羅三藐三菩提記。』
translation: When that woman heard that I had received the assurance, she said with a start, 'I will be like this bodhisattva in a future life and receive the assurance of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 當知是女人於然燈佛所初發心。」
translation: You should know that this is a woman who first arouses the intention of Randamāṇa Buddha."

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是女人久習行阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。」
translation: This woman has long cultivated the practice of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment."

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是！
translation: The Buddha said, "So it is!

source_sentence: 如是！
translation: So it is!

source_sentence: 是女人久習行阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。」
translation: This woman has long cultivated the practice of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment."

source_sentence: 【論】問曰：如是大眾聞說淨國土行，何以但一女人取淨國土願？
translation: [Commentary] They asked, "Thus, the whole assembly has heard about the practice of purifying the land, but why is it that only one woman has taken up the vow to purify the land?

source_sentence: 答曰：多有發淨國土願者，但不發言；女人性輕躁好勝，世世習氣故發言。
translation: They reply, "Many people who give rise to the vow to purify the land don't speak; women are impatient and competitive by nature, and their worldly impressions cause them to speak.

source_sentence: 復次，有人言：大人有得道分，餘人無分；佛法不然，隨眾生業因緣。
translation: Furthermore, some people say, "Adults have a share in attaining the Way, but others don't; otherwise, the Buddha's teaching follows the causes and conditions of sentient beings' actions.

source_sentence: 譬如良藥療治諸病，不擇貴賤。
translation: It's like a good medicine that treats illnesses without discriminating between high and low.

source_sentence: 雖復女人淺智，而先世業因緣，應得受記；心生欲說，故佛聽自說。
translation: Even though a woman's knowledge is shallow, the causes and conditions of her prior lives deserve to be recorded; her mind gives rise to a desire to speak, so the Buddha listens to her own words.

source_sentence: 復次，若佛默然與受記者，人則生疑：「有何因緣故，獨與此女受記？」
translation: Furthermore, if the Buddha were to silently give the impression to a reporter, people would wonder, "What cause and reason did he give this woman alone to receive the impression?"

source_sentence: 是故佛因其自說故而與受記。
translation: Therefore, the Buddha gave him a prediction because he taught it himself.

source_sentence: 問曰：何以名為「恒伽提婆」？
translation: Q: Why is it called "Hangadeva"?

source_sentence: 答曰：一切皆有名字，為識故，何足求義？
translation: Answer: "Everything has a name, so what's the point of seeking it for the sake of consciousness?

source_sentence: 有人言：是女父母供養恒伽神，得此女故，言恒伽提婆。
translation: Someone said, "This woman's parents made offerings to the god Gaṅgā and obtained this woman, so they said Gaṅgadeva.

source_sentence: 恒伽是河名，提婆名天。
translation: "Gaṅgā is the name of a river, and Deva is called a god.

source_sentence: 是女人福德因緣，生於富家，聞佛法信樂故，能以金銀寶華、金縷織成上下衣，并莊嚴自身瓔珞具，用供養上佛。
translation: Because of her good fortune and causes, that woman was born into a wealthy family and heard about the Buddha's teachings and was faithful, she was able to make offerings to the Buddha with gold, silver, and precious flowers, gold thread for her upper and lower garments, and adorned herself with jewelry.

source_sentence: 佛報以受記，觀是女人宿世所行，便微笑。
translation: In return, the Buddha accepts his prediction and smiles when he observes what this woman has done in previous lifetimes.

source_sentence: 微笑義如先說。
translation: The meaning of "smiling" is as explained earlier.

source_sentence: 此中小因緣而起大事，故佛微笑。
translation: This is a small cause and condition that gives rise to a great matter, so the Buddha smiles.

source_sentence: 問曰：是女福德應久轉女人，何以方於阿閦佛國乃轉女身？
translation: He asked, "Should this woman's virtue have changed into that of a woman in the past, why did she only change into a woman's body once she arrived at Akṣobhya?

source_sentence: 答曰：世間五欲難斷，女人著欲情多故，雖世世行諸福德，不能得男子身；今得受記，諸煩惱折薄，是故於阿閦佛國方得男子身。
translation: Answer: "The five worldly desires are difficult to stop, and because women are so attached to their desires, they haven't been able to attain a man's body despite all the merit they've cultivated over the ages; now that they've received assurance of assurance, their afflictions have been weakened, and it's only in Akṣobhya that they've attained a man's body.

source_sentence: 有人言：此女宿世以人多輕女人故，願女身受記。
translation: Some people say, "In a long time, this woman despised women because many people despised women, so she wanted to be remembered in a woman's body.

source_sentence: 如是等因緣，不轉女身而得受記。
translation: For these reasons, she won't change into a woman's body but will receive assurance of future attainment of the mark.

source_sentence: 復次，經說女人五礙，不說不得受記，是故不應生難。
translation: Furthermore, the sūtras say that there are five obstacles for women, but they don't say that they can't receive assurance of assurance, so that shouldn't be difficult.

source_sentence: 阿難聞是女人無量劫中從一佛國至一佛國廣集功德，當來得淨佛世界，其中菩薩皆有三十二相、八十種隨形好、無量光明，是故阿難歎未曾有：「能如是淨佛國土，便為如佛會。」
translation: Ānanda heard that this woman had accumulated merits from one Buddha-land to another over an immeasurable number of eons and would in the future purify the Buddha-realm, in which bodhisattvas all have thirty-two marks, eighty kinds of proportionate features, and measureless light.

source_sentence: 佛可其言已，阿難等疑此女人希有，聞少法而得大果報，是故難問：「是女人從何處殖諸德本？」
translation: After the Buddha approved of their words, Ānanda and the others doubted that this woman was rare and had heard so little about the Dharma and yet had attained such great rewards that it was difficult to ask, "Where did this woman cultivate all her virtues?"

source_sentence: 佛答：「定光佛授我記時，是女人持金華散佛，彼作是願：『此人後成佛時，亦當受與我記。』
translation: The Buddha answered, "When the Buddha of Radiant Concentration gave me this assurance, that woman held a golden-flower scattering buddha, and she made this vow, 'When this person later becomes a buddha, he or she will also receive my assurance of approval.'

source_sentence: 從彼種善根，今得果報。」
translation: From those good roots he planted, and now he's reaped the rewards."
